text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.4.44, IDRS Terminal Input, Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT and XSENT.
2.4.44.1 Updated the required Internal Controls Section.
IRM 2.4.44, dated August 13, 2021, is superseded.
LMSB, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I.

and (
) This IRM section provides the instructions for the use of Excess Collection (XSF) command codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT (
) Purpose These sections provides instructions for inputting information to the URF database (
) Audience All IRS business areas. (
) Policy Owner Chief Information Officer (
) Program Owner IDRS (

) Primary Stakeholders Wage & Investment (W&I), Large Business and Inter- national (LB&I), Small Business Self-Employed (SB/SE), Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE), and Enterprise Operations (EOPS). (
) Program Goals This system manages data that was extracted from the Corporate Account Data Stores (BMF and IMF) allowing IRS employees to take speciﬁc actions on taxpayer account issues. (
) The Excess Collection File (XSF) contains all non-revenue receipt credits. Command Code XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT are used add/update DC records from the Excess Collection File. (
) The Director, Business Support, is the director responsible for the servicewide civil penalty program. (
) The Director, Internal Management, is the director responsible for the IDRS Command Code. (

) Overall responsibility for civil penalty programs is assigned to OSP. OSP is matrix organization residing in the Business Support (Small Business/Self Employed) Function. OSP is charged with coordinating policy and procedures concerning the civil penalty program administration, ensuring consistency with the penalty policy statement, reviewing and analyzing penalty information, re- searching penalty effectiveness on compliance trends, and determining appropriate action necessary to promote voluntary compliance. (

) Each and every taxpayer has a set of fundamental rights when dealing with IRS as provided in the Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR). All employees handling penalty cases must do so in accordance with the TBOR as listed in IRC
) . The TBOR can also be found at Taxpayer Bill of Rights on irs.gov (

) Every function in the IRS has a role in proper penalty administration. It is essential that each function conduct its operations with an emphasis on promoting voluntary compliance. Appropriate business reviews should be conducted to ensure consistency with the penalty policy statement ( Policy Statement

) and philosophy. Attention should be directed to penalty program coordination between offices and functions to make sure that ap- proaches are consistent and penalty information is used for identifying and responding to compliance problems. Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and
page
Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT 2.4.44 page
This IRM section provides the instructions for the use of Excess Collection File (XSF) command codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT

) Every function in the IRS has a role in proper penalty administration. It is essential that each function conduct its operations with an emphasis on promoting voluntary compliance. Appropriate business reviews should be conducted to ensure consistency with the penalty policy statement ( Policy Statement

) and philosophy. Attention should be directed to penalty program coordination between offices and functions to make sure that ap- proaches are consistent and penalty information is used for identifying and responding to compliance problems.
) SACS controls all the IDRS user accesses and permissions. (
) The Excess Collection File (XSF) contains two accounts, non-revenue receipts credits in Account
(Excess Collections) and Account

(Revenue Clearance Accountability). Each record within the ﬁle contains the Control Number, amount and source of the credit, IRS received date, status code and other available payment and follow-up information. (

) The XSF is maintained in IDRS with the use of several command codes: • CC XSADD adds to the Excess Collection File. • CC XSADDR generates the format to be used in adding a record to the ﬁle. • CC XSADDM generates a format to be used in adding a record to the ﬁle while debiting it from the Master File. • CC XSAPL generates the format to be used by CC XSAPL. • CC XSAPLR generates the format to be used by CC XSAPL. • CC XSAPL applies from the ﬁle and will also generate a
CG notice or a

SP Spanish notice. • CC XSOUT changes or voids a record. • CC XSENT will do one or all of the following: Change record status, add follow-up information to the record, correct erroneous names and address, add, delete, or change an employee number, change document locator numbers, add or change TRACE-ID, add or change SSNs and change the IRS Received Date on the record. • CC XSREFR generates the format to be used in the XSF refund appli- cation command code. • CC XSREF makes refund applications. Note: History of the XS record and status changes are recorded with all command codes (

) Research of the XSF is done with CC XSINQ, and can be researched in three different ways: by amount of remittance, name control, or DLN. If the DLN is not known, adding the Area Office to one of the other data elements will narrow the search down from region wide to that area. (
) XSF records are established, corrected and applied only by the Campus Excess Collection function in the Accounting Branch. (
) XSF applications will be numbered daily via the IDRS computer’s blocking and numbering run. (

) ACCOUNTING CONTROL: The CC’s XSADD and XSAPL have, as part of their function, a running subtotal of items and monies being entered. Note: Before entering records into the XS ﬁle, the operator should have pre- determined the total number of items and money amounts involved. Then, after the operator has completed the adding to, the operator should compare the total item count and money involved appearing on the screen (line one) with the pre-determined totals to see if they are the same. When the totals are not the same, the operator must recall each record previously entered,

(Excess Collections) and Account

(Revenue Clearance Accountability). Each record within the ﬁle contains the Control Number, amount and source of the credit, IRS received date, status code and other available payment and follow-up information. (

CC XSADDM generates a format to be used in adding a record to the ﬁle while debiting it from the Master File. CC XSAPL generates the format to be used by CC XSAPL. CC XSAPLR generates the format to be used by CC XSAPL. CC XSAPL applies from the ﬁle and will also generate a
CG notice or a

SP Spanish notice. CC XSOUT changes or voids a record. CC XSENT will do one or all of the following: Change record status, follow-up information to the record, correct erroneous names and address, add, delete, or change an employee number, change document locator numbers, add or change TRACE-ID, add or change SSNs and change the IRS Received Date on the record. CC XSREFR generates the format to be used in the XSF refund appli- cation command code. CC XSREF makes refund applications.
Note: History of the XS record and status changes are recorded with all command codes

) XSF records are established, corrected and applied only by the Campus Excess Collection function in the Accounting Branch. (
) XSF applications will be numbered daily via the IDRS computer’s blocking and numbering run. (

When the totals are not the same, the operator must recall each record previously entered,

determine which XS record is in error, using CC XSINQ. When a record determined to be in error, corrections to the money amount may be made using CC XSOUT-“Z”. (

) CC’s XSADD, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSREF displays are in an overlay The end of line symbol may be used to blank out unnecessary data and down to the next line to facilitate input. For ease of input, the EMPLOYEE- ASG-NUM will be returned after each “Request Completed”for XSADDM. (

represents valid transactions in table form that may be input with XSAPL “M” type from the XSF to Master File. These transactions are shown for the correspond- ing ﬁle—IMF or BMF. (

determine which XS record is in error, using CC XSINQ. When a record is determined to be in error, corrections to the money amount may be made using CC XSOUT-“Z”.

) CC’s XSADD, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSREF displays are in an overlay format. The end of line symbol may be used to blank out unnecessary data and skip down to the next line to facilitate input. For ease of input, the EMPLOYEE- ASG-NUM will be returned after each “Request Completed”for XSADDM. (

represents the valid transactions in table form that may be input with XSAPL “M” type applies from the XSF to Master File. These transactions are shown for the correspond- ing ﬁle—IMF or BMF.
Use this command code to request screen display of XSAPL format.
Error messages appear on line 12 or line 13. Listed below are the XSF error messages with condition and resolution of that error condition.
Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT 2.4.44
ERROR MESSAGES
1. Error Message: “AMOUNT FIELD INVALID”
a. The amount ﬁeld is not formatted correctly, or b. The PRIMARY
TRANS
AMT in XSOUT “Z” is equal to the ORIGINAL
AMT in the XS record, or c. The ORIGINAL
AMT and BALANCE
AMT within the record are not identical. a. Correct and re
enter, or b. PRIMARY
TRANS
AMT must be different, or c. Review/Apply info.—use VOID
2. Error Message: “APPLICATION AMOUNT EXCEEDS BALANCE”
4. Error Message: “DUPLICATE CONTROL NO—ADD DENIED”
Another exact CTRL-NUM is present on the existing XS File.
ERROR MESSAGES
5. Error Message: “NAME LINE INVALID”
6. Error Message: “NARRATIVE MISSING OR INVALID ”
The REMARKS ﬁeld is all blank.
The ﬁrst position is blank.
The REMARKS ﬁeld exceeds
positions. Begin your REMARKS in the ﬁrst position and keep them within the positions.
1. The REMARKS ﬁeld is all blank.
7. Error Message: “nn ERRORS-CORRECT * FIELDS & RE-ENTER”
One or more of the INPUT DATA ﬁelds are in error (fail to pass validity checks). Invalid ﬁelds will be indicated by having an asterisk (
) right of the data ﬁeld. “nn” will indicate how many ﬁelds are invalid and must be corrected.
Self-explanatory.
Change search or apply information and re-enter.
9. Error Message: “PRIOR COMMAND CODE NOT COMPATIBLE”
The command code immediately pro
ceeding the one just entered was not correct for inquiry or for processing, e.g. XSADD entered and XSAPL was overlaid.
Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT 2.4.44 page 7
ERROR MESSAGES

11. Error Message: “STATUS CHANGE NOT ALLOWED ”
12. Error Message: “STATUS CODE INVALID”
OPEN to IDEN or FROZ
IDEN to OPEN or FROZ, or
FROZ to OPEN or IDEN Correct and re-enter.
13. Error Message: “SUBTOTALS NOT AVAILABLE FOR RECALL” (Only when using RECALL-CD)
1. No prior totals are stored, or
EMPLEE-NUM is not the same as the one used to store the subtotal, or *
Prior command code is not compat- ible with the command code being entered.
ERROR MESSAGES
Recall to the screen all prior entries to get totals entered up to this point.
15. Error Message: “CONTROL NUMBER/NAME CONTROL MISMATCH”
16. Error Message: “NAME CONTROL INVALID
NAME-CTRL is not four positions when input.
NAME-CTRL is not alpha or numeric in the ﬁrst position.
First position is a blank. Correct and re-enter.
17. Error Message: “CONTROL NUMBER/AMOUNT MISMATCH”
18. Error Message: “CONTROL NUMBER/BOTH NC AMT MISMATCH”
The CTRL-NUM is on ﬁle but the amount and NAME-CTRL input do not match the amount and name control in the record.
Correct and re-enter.
Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT 2.4.44
ERROR MESSAGES
19. Error Message: “ASTERISK MISSING OR POSITIONED WRONG”
Insert an asterisk and re-enter.
20. Error Message: “N/C AMT OR CONTROL NUMBER REQUIRED”
None of the required input data are present on the input screen. One of the following must be re
entered: NAME
CTRL, amount or CTRL
NUM.
21. Error Message: “NEW CITY STATE ZIP INVALID ”
22. Error Message: “NEW STREET ADDRESS INVALID ”
NEW-STREET-ADDR does not begin in the ﬁrst position.
First position is not alpha-numeric. Enter NEW-STREET-ADDR line beginning in the ﬁrst position.
23. Error Message: “DLN ALREADY EXISTS ON FILE”
Reassign a different DLN and re-enter.
24. Error Message: “NAME CHANGE EXCEEDS 35 CHARACTERS”
ERROR MESSAGES
An attempt has been made to change the name on a XS record with a name greater than
characters. Shorten NAME LINE to
characters less.
25. Error Message: “JOURNAL STATUS INVALID FOR CC”
An attempt was made to change a XSF record using a URF record.
Use XSF command code and re-input.
26. Error message: “RECORD IS IN VOID STATUS ”
27. Error Message: “DUPLICATE CHANGE LITERALS NOT ALLOWED”
An attempt has been made to change a literal already assigned.
Correct and re-enter.
28. Error Message: “PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA”
29. Error Message: “BLANK LINE BETWEEN CHANGES NOT ALLOWED”
30. Error Message: “CHANGES MUST BEGIN ON SCREEN LINE 4”
Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT 2.4.44 page 11

32. Error Message: “UPDATE(S) NOT ALLOWED STATUS FROZEN”
33. Error Message: “DUPLICATE TIN NOT ACCEPTED ”
34. Error Message: “INVALID DLN INPUT”
35. Error Message: “DUPLICATE SOURCE-CD NOT ACCEPTED”
36. Error Message: “FIRST NAME LINE EXCEEDS 35 CHARAC- TERS”
ERROR MESSAGES
Self-explanatory.
37. Error Message: “SECOND NAME LINE EXCEEDS 35 CHARAC- TERS”
38. Error Message: “TIF, URF, OR TRAINING AREA DOWN OR STRICTED”
Contact Campus Data Base Administra
tor to ﬁnd out if this is correct and how long.
39. Error Message: “NAME LINE 1 IS EQUAL TO SPACES OR EQUALS LITERAL”
No change has been made to screen literals.
b. Solution:
Re-input name on name line 1.
40. Error Message: “MONEY AMOUNT NOT IN CORRECT FIELD”
Re-input money amount in correct ﬁeld.
41. Error Message: “BMF ACCESS RESTRICTED
An attempt has been made by the user to access an IMF account. User is not proﬁled to access this type of account. Refer to IRM
42. Error Message: “IMF ACCESS RESTRICTED ”
Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT 2.4.44 page 13
ERROR MESSAGES
An attempt has been made by the user to access a BMF account. User is not proﬁled to access this type of account.
43. Error Message: “TIN NOT ESTABLISHED ON MF”
Check to make sure the TIN is correct. If it is, this message means that this taxpayer is not yet on the Master File.
44. Error Message: “Name Control Mismatch on NAP File”
The Name Control cannot be matched against the National Accounts Proﬁle (NAP).
against the National Accounts Proﬁle (NAP). Check to make sure the Name Control is correct. If it is, use CC TXMOD to check for prior names.
45. Error Message: “INVALID TIN-TYPE”
This response indicates a program error. Notify the IDRS Control Staff.
46. Error Message: “TIN IS NOT ON EPMF OR BMF”
47. Error Message: “TIN IS NOT ON EPMF; IS ON BMF”
ERROR MESSAGES
48. Error Message: “CRS/NAP ACCESS NOT AVAILABLE: TRY LATER”
The Communication Replacement System (CRS) for the National Account Proﬁle (NAP) is not available at this time. Processing cannot continue.
49. Error Message: “NAP ENTITY FILE NOT AVAILABLE: TRY LATER”.
The National Entity File is unavailable at this time. Processing cannot continue.
50. Error Message:“SSN NOT ON MF VALID OR INVALID-INOLE CAN BE USED TO VALIDATE DM-1 SSN/NAME”
Check TIN or NAME
CTRL for errors or use CC INOLE to verify TIN and NAME
CTRL
51. Error Message: “ACCOUNT FOUND ON OPPOSITE VALIDITY- INOLE CAN BE USED TO VALIDATE SSN/NAME”
The account could not be found on the NAP. Check TIN or NAME
CTRL for errors or use CC INOLE to verify TIN and NAME
CTRL.
b. Solution:
52. Error Message: “INVALID REQUEST-NAP”
53. Error Message: “DEADLOCK CONDITION PRESENT ”
This account is currently being used by another run.
Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT 2.4.44

Please try again later or try another area.

Please try again later or try another area.

Please try again later or try another area.

The maximum allowable pending TIF63 records is 96. Your request will exceed this amount.
Error Message: “S-XPASS TIMED OUT - TRY AGAIN LATER. a. Error Condition: The subroutine has timed out. b. Solution: Please try your request again later.
Error Message: “S-XPASS IS NOT AVAILABLE - TRY AGAIN
64. Error Message: “S-XPASS IS NOT AVAILABLE - TRY LATER.”
The subroutine is currently not available.
Please try your request again later.
Error Message: “OTHER S-XPASS ERROR - CALL CSA.. ” a. Error Condition: There is a problem with the subroutine. b. Solution: Please contact a CSA for further instructions.

COMMAND-CD XSADD CC-DEFINER—Must be R or M. (a) Enter “R” to generate the input format for adding an account to XSF, (b) Enter “M” to generate special format for adding an account to XSF while debiting it from the Master File. RECALL-CD—Input “C”only to request a new XSADD format when the block subtotals must be retained. (See CC XSADD—Items
, and
RECALL-CD—Input “C”only to request a new XSADD format when the block subtotals must be retained. (See CC XSADD—Items 3,4, and 5)

Record Element Description:

DESCRIPTION AND VALIDITY
SOURCE-CD-An overlay, must be present and alpha, indicates the area from which the XS record originated.
If blank, status will be OPEN.
TYPE-OF-PAYMENT—Must be 2 position alpha code to designate the type of remittance received.
BC— Business Check CA— Cash (includes cash conversions) CC— Cashier’s Check

ITEM
GC— Government Check MO— Money Order PC— Personal Check FD— Federal Tax Deposit (includes Certiﬁcates of Deposit) WH— Withholding UK— Unknown

RECVD-DT—Must be present when SOURCE-CD is “OT”. Valid month, day, year combination and will be formatted MMDDYYYY. When DOC-CODE of CTRL- NUM is 48, 58 or 65, RECVD-DT must be current date or older. Otherwise, the RECVD-DT must be more than 1 year old.
NAME-LINE- 1— Must be present ; ﬁrst position must be alpha or numeric. Input name line as follows:
a. IMF—Smith, John J. N/C SMIT b. BMF—Smith, John M. N/C SMIT c. BMF—John M. Smith Co. Inc. N/C JOHN d. Multiple BMF Names— N/C SMIT (Partnership) Smith
Jones
Roberts Co. e. Unknown—Unknown N/C UNKN

CITY-STATE-ZIP–INPUT—A “#”(pound sign) in the ﬁrst position indicates a foreign address and requires only that the rest of the input ﬁeld not be blank. Otherwise, the ﬁeld must contain one of the following:
) a Major- City-Code followed by blanks or blank, Zip-Cd, blanks;
) a complete City/St/Zip. If the input is a valid Major- City-Cd but the corresponding City is more than
characters in length, the input will be ﬂagged. If the input is a complete City/St/Zip, the format must be City followed by comma, State (
positions standard state abbr.), blank, Zip. The City cannot exceed
characters in length. PAYMENT-INFO— Must be present , check or money
Exhibit 2.4.44-4 (Cont. 3) (01-01-2016) CC XSADD with Deﬁner “R” XS-ADD-REALTIME-INPUT
DESCRIPTION AND VALIDITY
PAYMENT-INFO-2—Optional. Used as a continuation PAYMENT-INFO line. 50 positions maximum.
TRACE-ID— Must be present , and must be all numeric. Can be all zeroes OR must be entered as follows:

Pos 1-2 is the site-id and must be a valid Campus Code, a valid District Office Code, a valid Area Office Code, or a valid Lockbox Bank ID. This does not have to be a current, valid code. It can be a valid one from the past.
Pos 7-13 is the julian deposit date and it must be greater than 2006001. It cannot be greater than the current date.
Pos 19-24 is the transaction sequence number and it must be greater than 000000.

Valid response also includes the XSADD format, which will be redisplayed after each addition. A subtotal of item count and amount added to this point will be shown on one line. Valid response also includes the XSADD format, which will be redisplayed after each addition. A subtotal of item count and amount added to this point will be shown on one line. PRIMARY-TRANS-CD is 694 and DESIGNATED- PAYMENT-CD is 49, amount must equal $52.00. If PRIMARY-TRANS-CD is 694 and DESIGNATED- PAYMENT-CD is 50, amount must equal $120.00. If PRIMARY-TRANS-CD is 694 and DESIGNATED- PAYMENT-CD is 44, amount must equal $107.00. If PRIMARY-TRANS-CD is 694 and DESIGNATED- PAYMENT-CD is 45, amount must equal $225.00. If PRIMARY-TRANS-CD is 694 and DESIGNATED- PAYMENT-CD is 46, amount must equal $89.00.

SECONDARY-TRANS-AMT—If the SECONDARY- TRANS-CD is 570, amount ﬁeld is blank. If the SECONDARY-TRANS-CD is 270, amount may be equal to or greater than zero. If DESIGNATED-PAYMENT-CD 47, 48, 49, 50 or 51 present, SECONDARY-TRANS- AMT must equal PRIMARY-TRANS-AMT. All other SECONDARY-TRANS-AMT must be greater than zero and may not exceed the PRIMARY-TRANS-AMT.
TERTIARY-TRANS-CD—Can be present only when PRIMARY-TRANS-CD is present.

TERTIARY-TRANS-AMT—Must be present when TERTIARY-TRANS-CD is present. Amount must be greater than zero and the sum of PRIMARY-TRANS- AMT and TERITARY-TRANS-AMT cannot exceed the balance amount in the XS record.
TIN-FILE-SOURCE-EDITED—nnn-nn-nnnn or nn- nnnnnnn format. IMF—Use * on invalid segment, BMF—blank, V (valid SSN) or W (invalid SSN).
DESIGNATED-PAYMENT-CD—
When PRIMARY-TRANS-CD 640 is used with MFT 35 or MFT 65, if DPC is not entered, it will default to DPC of 36;otherwise, valid DPC for MFT 35 and 65 is 36.
When PRIMARY-TRANS-CD 640 is used with MFT if DPC is not entered, it will default to DPC of 43;otherwise, valid DPC for MFT 43 is 43.
When PRIMARY-TRANS-CD 670 is used with MFT 35 or MFT 65, if DPC is not entered, it will default to DPC of 36;otherwise, valid DPCs for MFT 35 and MFT 65 are 03, 09, 10, 14, 24, 34, 35, or 36.
When PRIMARY-TRANS-CD 670 is used with MFT 43, if DPC is not entered, it will default to DPC of 43;otherwise, valid DPC for MFT 43 is 43.
Exhibit 2.4.44-11 (Cont. 3) (09-01-2021) XS-APPLY-REALTIME-INPUT-“M” Apply
Description and Validity

When PRIMARY-TRANS-CD 670 is used with MFTs other than 35 or 43 or 65, if DPC is not entered, it will default to DPC of 00. Valid DPCs are 00 through 11, 13, 14, 16, 17, 20 through 23, 26, 31, 33, 34, 35, or 99. If DPC = 26 or 31, MFT must =31.
When PRIMARY-TRANS-CD 694 is used along with SECONDARY-TRANS-CD 360, you must enter 47, 48, 49, 50 or 51 as the DPC.

TAX-PRD-IMF, the return tax period may not be earlier than 196212; BMF MFT 01, 03, 04, or 09, tax period may not be earlier than 196203. BMF MFT 02, 05, 06, 10, or 11, tax period may not be earlier than 196112. BMF MFT 08, tax period may not be earlier than 200412. MFT 40, tax period may not be earlier than 200401. MFT 17 tax period may not be earlier than 200512. BMF MFT 14, tax period may not be earlier than 200612. IMF MFT 35, tax period may not be earlier than 201412. BMF MFT 43, tax period may not be earlier than 201512 & month must be 12.
MFT-CD—See TAX-PRD consistency check. NOTE - For year 2015, the only Primary Trans Cd that should be used with MFT 43 is Trans Cd 640.

PLAN-NUM—Present only when MFT is 46, 74 or 76. Format is nnn. If MFT is 46, valid PLAN-NUM range is 000, 100-599, 700-999. If MFT is 74, valid PLAN-NUM range is 001-999. If MFT is 76, valid PLAN-NUM range is 000-499, 501-999.
RE-MARKS—Must be included on all applies.
Note: If MFT-CD is 46, 74 or 76, PLAN-NUM must be present.
Terminal Responses:
Error Responses: Error messages appear on line 13. Valid Response: The XSAPL format will be redisplayed after each application, with the message REQUEST COMPLETED appearing on line 13.

Exhibit 2.4.44-17 (Cont. 1) (07-01-2012) XS-ENTITY-CHG-INPUT
COMMAND-CD
COMMAND-CD NAME-CTRL—Must match the NAME-CTRL on the XS record. CTRL-NUM-EDITED—Must match the CTRL-NUM on the XS record. Note: Lines
will be used to update the
st NL,
nd NL, Street Address, City/Stat/Zip, Status-Cd and IRS-Recvd-DT and/or to add a narrative. The ﬁrst element being changed and/or added must be entered on Line
The next element being changed and/or added must appear on the next line , etc.

NEW-FIRST-NAME-LINE—If being changed, enter N1/ immediately followed by the new name line. A new name control will be generated for the Excess Collection File record. First position must be alpha or numeric
Description and Validity

NEW-STREET-ADDR—If being added or changed, enter ST/ immediately followed by the new street address data. The ﬁeld must contain a valid character other than a blank in the ﬁrst position. Optional when changing City/State/Zip.
NEW-CITY-STATE-ZIP—If being added or changed, enter CS/immediately followed by one of the following:
) a Major City Code followed either by blanks or by blank, Zip-Cd, blanks;
) a complete City/State/Zip. If the input is a valid Major- City-Cd but the corresponding City is more than
characters in length, the input will be ﬂagged. If the input is a complete City/St/Zip, the format must be City followed by comma, State (
position standard state abbr.), blank, Zip. The City cannot exceed
characters in length. If a foreign address, enter a pound sign (#) in position
followed by the foreign address.
STATUS-CD—If being changed, enter SC/ immediately followed by change. Valid changes are: 1) OPEN to IDEN or FROZ, 2) IDEN to OPEN or FROZ, and 3) FROZ to OPEN or IDEN.
IRS-RECVD-DT—If being changed, enter RD/ immedi- ately followed by new date. If entered, valid month, day, year combination will be formatted MMDDYYYY
NARRATIVE—If being added, enter NR/ immediately followed by narrative. First position must not be blank and the ﬁeld cannot exceed 70 characters.
EMPLEE-NUM—If being added or changed, enter EN/ immediately followed by the 10 digit employee number.
EMPLEE-NUM—If being deleted enter DE/ immediately followed by spaces.
TIN—If being added or changed enter TN/ immediately followed by a SSN/EIN.
TRACE-ID—If being added or changed enter TI/ imme- diately followed by a valid TRACE-ID:
Command Codes XSADD, XSREF, XSAPL, XSOUT, and XSENT 2.4.44 page 63
Exhibit 2.4.44-17 (Cont. 3) (07-01-2012) XS-ENTITY-CHG-INPUT
Description and Validity
Item

Pos 4-5 is the site-id and must be a valid Campus Code, a valid District Office Code, a valid Area Office Code, or a valid Lockbox Bank ID. This does not have to be a current, valid code. It can be a valid one from the past.
Pos 10-16 is the julian deposit date and it must be greater than 2006001. It cannot be greater than the current date.
Pos 18-20 is the sequence number and it must be greater than 000.
Pos 22-27 is the transaction sequence number and it must be greater than 000000.
a. Error Responses: Error messages will be displayed on line 13. b. Valid Response: REQUEST COMPLETED message will be displayed on line 13.
